radiographic_examinations.findings: Partially cystic mass (1.5 cm in diameter) in the right thalamus and upper midbrain.
Mass, 4.8 cm by 3.2 cm, in the lower lobe of the right lung; no hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
Intense 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) avidity in the right lower lobe, corresponding to the mass seen on CT.
Rim-enhancing lesion, 2.6 cm in diameter, in the right thalamus with surrounding mass effect; smaller enhancing lesion in the left cerebral hemisphere.

radiographic_examinations.date: Nine months after right lower lobectomy
radiographic_examinations.findings: New nodule, 1.3 cm in the mid-lobe of the right lung, and multiple bilateral lung nodules, consistent with recurrent NSCLC.

radiographic_examinations.date: 2 months after initiation of erlotinib treatment
radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete resolution of the lung nodules; no evidence of mediastinal lymphadenopathy or metastatic disease outside the chest.
